content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the reason for excluding hybrid males when calculating the allele frequencies of two interbreeding populations at the intermediate stage of speciation (Figure 2) ?

choices.label: The process of mate selection in large groups often favors females over males.
The frequency of sex-determining chromosomes is usually equal to 0.5.
Sterile individuals make no genetic contribution to the next generation.
The chance of inheriting a recessive allele from a male is too small to calculate.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
